meaning.meaning: center on, in the middle of
meaning.example: the center of our discussion

phrases.phrase: 今日の会議でこの議題を中心に議論をしましょう。
translations: Let's make this matter the central topic of the discussion at today's meeting,

phrases.phrase: 駅を中心にたくさんの商店が集まっている。
translations: Centered around the station there are many stores.

phrases.phrase: 中国を海外展開計画の中心に議論しましょう
translations: Let's make China the center of our overseas expansion plan discussion

phrases.phrase: この地方を中心として、山地は、本州の東北では三列に、同じく西南では二列に分かれて連なっています。
translations: Centered around this region, three separate mountain ranges extend towards north-east of Honshu, and two separate mountain ranges extend to the south-western part of Honshu

phrases.phrase: その家のことはすべてメアリーおばさんを中心に動いていた。
translations: Everything in that house revolved around Aunt Mary.

meaning.example: when i was in japan

phrases.phrase: 私は日本に行った時日本語を勉強した
translations: When  I was in Japan, I studied Japanese.

phrases.phrase: いつでも都合のいい時にお金を返してください。
translations: Pay me back when it's convenient.

phrases.phrase: 何というときに出てきたんだ！
translations: How on earth could you make your appearance at a crucial time like this!

phrases.phrase: 危険なとき
translations: When in danger

phrases.phrase: 会議のとき
translations: During the meeting

meaning.example: I'm using this room as a storeroom.

phrases.phrase: この部屋は物置として使っている。
translations: I'm using this room as a storeroom.

phrases.phrase: 李さんは自動車の会社でエンジニアとして働いている。
translations: Mister Lee is working in a car maker firm as an engineer.

phrases.phrase: 彼は単に冗談としてそれを言った。
translations: He said it merely as a joke.

phrases.phrase: 先生として働いています。
translations: I work as a teacher.

phrases.phrase: 私は医者としてあなたに言います。
translations: I'll tell you this as a doctor.

meaning.example: contrary to expectations

phrases.phrase: 両親の期待に反して女の子が生まれた。
translations: Contrary to the parents expectations, a girl was born.

phrases.phrase: 国民の期待に反して政府は年金制度改正法案の強行採決に踏み切った。
translations: Contrary to the peoples expectations, the government bulldozed the pension system revision bill through the Diet.

phrases.phrase: 研究社員になる希望に反して大学を止めらなければなりませんでした。
translations: I had to drop out of university against my aspirations of becoming a scientist.

phrases.phrase: 神の意向に反して人間は自然を破壊している。
translations: Contrary to God's will, humans are destroying nature.

phrases.phrase: （僕の期待に反して）実のところ物価は毎週上昇している。
translations: ( Against my expectations) prices are going up every week.（M)

meaning.meaning: and then, after that; Due to that
meaning.example: Then, what happened? /Due to a early frost, the apple harvest will be small this year.

phrases.phrase: 朝寝坊した。それで仕事に遅れたんだ。
translations: I overslept. Due to that,  I was late for work.

phrases.phrase: ３時のバスで行こうよ。それでいいかい？
translations: I say we catch the 3 o'clock bus. Is that alright with you?

phrases.phrase: それでどうなりましたか？
translations: And then  what happened?

phrases.phrase: それでこのカードに記入してください。
translations: Then you just have to fill out this card.

phrases.phrase: それでこれ以上の義務を負わなくてよくなる。
translations: That absolves me from further responsibility.

meaning.example: It's summer but it's cold.

translations: Even though  I bought this computer one year ago, it's already old fashioned.

translations: This information is not as up-to-date as it should be.

phrases.phrase: これは新しい靴なのにもう修理する必要がある。

phrases.phrase: ずっと歩いて来たとは、あなたは足が丈夫なのにちがいない。
translations: You must be a good walker to have walked all the way.

translations: Jim awoke and found himself alone in the room.

meaning.example: he tends to be late

phrases.phrase: 私のボスは、短気で怒りがち。　　　（怒りっぽい is conventional.）
translations: My boss is short-tempered and tends to get  angry easily  .

phrases.phrase: 担当者の好き嫌いによる誤解も場合によっては起こりがち。
translations: Depending on the likes and dislikes of the person in charge it is also easy for mis-understandings to occur.

phrases.phrase: 曇りがち
translations: mainly  cloudy

phrases.phrase: 遠慮がち
translations: tends to be reserved

phrases.phrase: お金持ちは貧乏人を見下しがちである。
translations: The rich are apt to look down upon the poor.

meaning.meaning: It does not (necessarily) mean that 〜; I don't mean that 〜; It is not (true) that 〜; It is not the case that 〜
meaning.example: It doesn't necessarily mean he understood.

translations: it does not mean that there is no hope, but you'd better not expect too much

translations: While I am not saying he is stupid, I have my doubts when I look at what he is actually doing.

translations: Because people in the world don't speak the same language, much effort is now devoted to translation.

phrases.phrase: あの男しかいないわけではないよ。
translations: He is not the only pebble on the beach.

phrases.phrase: あれは全く誤りというわけではない。
translations: That is not altogether false.

meaning.meaning: is, would be, probably is; isn't it?
meaning.example: I guess it will rain today

phrases.phrase: 「かっこいいじゃん！」「でしょう、でしょう！！」
translations: "You look cool!" " Don't I? Don't I? "

phrases.phrase: 毒魚ってなんだろう？
translations: "Poison fish"- whadd'ya suppose they are?

phrases.phrase: 「洞窟の中で何が起こっているんだろう？すごく知りたいな。」「見当もつかないよ。」

translations: "What time is it?" he wondered.

meaning.meaning: of all the ... / especially / only / just

phrases.phrase: ローマ字しか書けません。

phrases.phrase: 田中さんしか来ませんでした。

meaning.meaning: by; according to; due to; owing to; due to

translations: This year, compared to last year, the quantity of rain is much more.

translations: According to America's NBC News, Reuters and such news agencies US President Bush is in the process of preparing an anouncement of a new plan for space exploration

phrases.phrase: あなたにしてあげる事は、これだけです。
translations: This is all I can do for you.

phrases.phrase: あなたに代わって買い物をして家を掃除して夕食を作ってあげる。
translations: I'll do your shopping, clean up the house, and cook your dinner for you.

phrases.phrase: いつかそのうちに動物園に連れてってあげるよ。
translations: I will take you to the zoo one of these days.

meaning.example: It's thanks to you that I received the promotion.

phrases.phrase: そんな中、ホストファミリーが陽気に話しかけ、あちらこちらへ連れ出してくれたお蔭で、徐々に英語にも慣れ理解できるようになっていきました。
translations: Among which, thanks to the host family cheerfully chatting with me, taking me hither and thither I gradually accustomed to and able to understand English.

phrases.phrase: あいつのお陰で事故に巻き込まれた。
translations: Thanks to him, I ended up getting involved in this accident.

phrases.phrase: 両親のお陰で、私はアルバイトをしないで勉強することができる。
translations: Thanks to my parents, I can study without working.

phrases.phrase: 私がアルバイトせずに勉強できるのは、両親のお陰だ。
translations: I can study without working thanks to my parents.

phrases.phrase: 君のおかげで、お金を全部使ってしまい歩いて帰宅せねばならなかった。
translations: Thanks to you, I spent all my money and had to walk home.

meaning.example: (1) He can't even read hiragana.

phrases.phrase: ひらがなからして読めない。もちろん漢字も読めない。
translations: Cannot even read hiragana, and also of course cannot read kanji

phrases.phrase: A国は食料からして、不足している。（暗示：だからガソリンなど、ほとんどないだろう）
translations: That country doesn't have enough food for a start (implies: so they definitely don't have enough gasoline etc.)

phrases.phrase: 彼の健康状態からしてスポーツは無理でしょう。
translations: Judging from his physical condition　doing sports would be unwise

phrases.phrase: 態度からしてけしからん
translations: Even his attitude is nasty.

phrases.phrase: 値段からして、Xの機種はYとは比べものにならないと思っていた。
translations: Given its price, I didn't expect the X machine to be in the same league as the Y machine.

meaning.example: Seems like he's caught a cold.

phrases.phrase: 彼は風邪をひいたみたいです。
translations: Seems like he's caught a cold.

phrases.phrase: まるで夢みたい
translations: It's like a dream

phrases.phrase: お前みたいな奴は見たことがない
translations: I've never met the likes of you!

phrases.phrase: 京都みたいな所に行くのが好きです
translations: I like to visit places like Kyoto

phrases.phrase: 外国に行くみたいなことを言っていました
translations: He was talking like he was going abroad

meaning.example: I should have studied more.

phrases.phrase: 私は列車に乗り遅れた。もっと早く来るべきだった。
translations: I missed the train. I should have come earlier.

phrases.phrase: われわれはなるべくたくさん本を読むべきである。
translations: We should read as many books as possible.

phrases.phrase: あなたは他の人たちの援助を当てにすべきでない。
translations: You shouldn't rely on other people's help.

phrases.phrase: いかに生きるべきかは、青年にとって重要な問題である。
translations: How to live is an important question to young people.

phrases.phrase: いつ出発するべきか私に教えてください。
translations: Please tell me when I should leave.

meaning.example: I talked it out with him.

phrases.phrase: 彼らはお互いに助けあった。
translations: They helped one another  .

phrases.phrase: 話しあうことでこの問題は解決できます。
translations: Through mutual discussion, this issue can be resolved.

phrases.phrase: あなたは、スミス氏と連絡を取り合うべきです。
translations: You should keep in touch with Mr. Smith.

phrases.phrase: お互いを理解し合うようにしようではありませんか。
translations: Let's try to understand one another.

phrases.phrase: お母さんは私に彼と付き合うなと言いました。
translations: My mother told me not to keep company with him.

meaning.example: oops, i said too much!

phrases.phrase: 秘密でしたか？ついうっかり喋ちゃいました。
translations: It was a secret? Oops! I spoke about it without thinking...

phrases.phrase: つい買っちゃった！
translations: Damn! I went and bought it (and I shouldn't have).

phrases.phrase: つい「コンピュータがおかしい」と思ってしまいます．でも，コンピュータ側がおかしいことはまずありません．
translations: I carelessly thought "There's something up with the computer". But actually there was nothing up with the _computer_ side.

phrases.phrase: つい先ほど時雨れた
translations: We had a light shower a while ago.

phrases.phrase: つい必要なワードフィルを削除してしまった。
translations: I just (unintentional) deleted an important word file.

meaning.meaning: In order to, because of, for
meaning.example: I telephoned to make sure he was coming.

phrases.phrase: 雪がたくさん降ったため試合が中止された。
translations: Because a lot of snow fell, the match was canceled.

phrases.phrase: 彼が来る事を確かめる為に電話をした。
translations: I telephoned to make sure that he was coming.

phrases.phrase: 彼は、去年老齢の為、なくなった。
translations: He died last year of old age.

phrases.phrase: このキーは何の為の物ですか？
translations: What's this key for ?

phrases.phrase: 外国人の為のいい辞書がない
translations: There are no good dictionaries for foreigners

meaning.example: we went shopping, and ate lunch

phrases.phrase: 開拓者達は辛い生活をしたし、彼らの子供もそうだった。
translations: Pioneer men and women had a hard life, and so did their children.

phrases.phrase: ここでの討論はおもしろいものでしたし、困惑させたり、ときにはぞっとする内容のものもありました。
translations: The debate has been interesting, (and) confusing, and sometimes horrifying.

phrases.phrase: ロッククライミングも、海で深く潜ることもしたし、インドネシアの熱帯雨林で眠ったこともある。
translations: I've done rock climbing and deep-sea diving and slept in rain forests in the jungle of Indonesia.

phrases.phrase: 彼は幸福だ。1つには、昇進したし、それに結婚したばかりだから。
translations: He is happy. For one thing, he's got a promotion and  for another he has just got married.

phrases.phrase: 母はその知らせを喜んでいたし、私もそうでした。
translations: My mother was happy about the news, and so was I.

meaning.meaning: Talking about relative location of an object
meaning.example: My hat is in your car

phrases.phrase: スポーツの中に、どちらが一番好き？
translations: out of all the sports, which do you like best?

phrases.phrase: その建物に銀行がありますか｡
translations: Is there a bank in that building?

phrases.phrase: ドアの近いにあるかばんは誰のですか｡
translations: whos bag is that by the door.

phrases.phrase: 車が家の左に止まっておいたよ｡
translations: I parked the car on the left side of the house.

phrases.phrase: チキンは冷凍庫の中です｡
translations: The chicken is in the freezer.

meaning.meaning: as it is, leave as it is, (remain) unchanged
meaning.example: I'll leave this place as it is.

phrases.phrase: ２つの問題が未解決のままであった。
translations: Two problems remained unsolved.

phrases.phrase: この家はこのままにしておきたい。
translations: I like this house as it is.

phrases.phrase: この家は今のままでは売れないだろう。
translations: This house will not sell as it stands.

phrases.phrase: この自転車は今月の初めからここに置かれたままだ。
translations: This bicycle has been left here since the beginning of this month.

phrases.phrase: この窓は一ヶ月割れたままになっている。
translations: This window has been broken for a month.

meaning.meaning: In a flash, before one knows it, in a blink of an eye, in no time, flash by, (time) flies
meaning.example: Time flies when you're having fun

phrases.phrase: あっという間に砂嵐に襲われた。
translations: Before we knew where we were, the dust storm was on us.

phrases.phrase: あっという間に逃げてしまった。
translations: He disappeared in an instant.

phrases.phrase: クリスマスの時期にはあっという間に満席になるから早く飛行機の蘭??ｵなさい。
translations: Book your flight early as it fills up quickly during Christmas.

phrases.phrase: クレジットカードを使うとあっという間に借金をつくりやすい。
translations: It's easy to get into debt quickly with charge cards.

phrases.phrase: 鳥はあっと言う間に飛び去った。
translations: The bird flew away in a flash.

meaning.example: if we assume that n=1

phrases.phrase: 日本へ行くとすれば
translations: If we assume that we go to japan

phrases.phrase: 温度は一定であるとする。
translations: We assume that temperature is constant.

phrases.phrase: あなたが立派な世界市民になろうとするなら、偏見は持たないように努力すべきである。
translations: If you are to be a good world citizen, you should try to be free of any prejudices.

phrases.phrase: 私たちは みな、 人生に おいて 成功を 収めようとするが、成功するのは、きわめて 数少ない人たちである。
translations: We all try hard to make the grade in life, but only a few succeed.

phrases.phrase: 進んで学ぼうとする気の無い物には教える甲斐がない。
translations: One who is not willing to learn is not worth teaching.

meaning.meaning: whether, the question of (sub sentence question)
meaning.example: Regardless of whether I had written it...

phrases.phrase: 私が書いたかを問わず、(全て）「作者：あまつか」です。
translations: Regardless of whether I had written it or not it's (always) "Author : Amatuka".

phrases.phrase: おまえは・・・・俺が誰か知ってるのか。
translations: You ... Don't you know who I am? [Lit: Do you know who I am?]

phrases.phrase: 今度の出張はいつかまだ分かりません。
translations: Regarding my next business trip, I still don't know when it's going to be.

phrases.phrase: 誰が一緒に出掛けたか教えてください。
translations: Please tell me who you went out with.

phrases.phrase: 書類どこにあるか(と)聞きました。
translations: I asked, where the documents are.

meaning.example: Don't do that!

phrases.phrase: バカなことするな！
translations: Don't do something that stupid!

phrases.phrase: あまり飲むな
translations: Don't  drink too much.

phrases.phrase: 馬鹿なことをするな。
translations: Don't  be silly

phrases.phrase: 誰も動くな。
translations: Nobody moves!

phrases.phrase: 心配するな。
translations: Don't  worry

meaning.meaning: (often it'd be better to do __) Such-and-such an option is something
meaning.example: You'd better study then.

phrases.phrase: ３月１日の方が都合がよいのですが。
translations: We feel that March 1 would be more convenient.

phrases.phrase: ９時以降に電話した方が安いですか。
translations: Is it cheaper to call after 9:00?

phrases.phrase: 物事を生半可に知っているくらいなら全然知らない方がましだ。
translations: I would rather not know a thing at all than know it imperfectly.

phrases.phrase: 遅くても着実な方が競争に勝つ。
translations: Slow but sure wins the race.

phrases.phrase: 私は肉より魚の方がいい。
translations: I prefer fish to meat.

meaning.example: Tokyo is larger than Kyoto.

phrases.phrase: 私は肉より魚の方がいい。
translations: I prefer fish to meat.

phrases.phrase: 現実は聞いたよりももっと悲しい。
translations: The reality is much sadder than what I have heard.

phrases.phrase: これよりほかに方法がないんだよ
translations: There's really no other better way than this.

phrases.phrase: 一般に日本人は、自分たちがかつてより暮し向きがよくなったと考えている。
translations: The Japanese at large consider themselves better off than they used to be.

phrases.phrase: 彼はわたしより速く走ることができる。
translations: He is able to run faster than I am.

meaning.meaning: seem, look like, apparently, I heard
meaning.example: It seems Tanaka will resign

phrases.phrase: 動かないらしい
translations: Seems like it doesn't work (lit: doesn't move)

phrases.phrase: そんな事をするなんて君らしくない。
translations: It doesn't seem like you doing such a thing.

phrases.phrase: 私は彼と彼のガールフレンドらしい人を見かけた。
translations: I saw him and a girl who looked to be his girlfriend.

phrases.phrase: みんなさんは夕方来るらしい。
translations: It seems everybody will come in the evening.

phrases.phrase: kyou ha,tenki ga yoirashiidesu.
translations: the weather today seems like good.

meaning.example: He's difficult to understand, isn't he?

phrases.phrase: 彼は分かりにくいでしょうかなぁ？
translations: He's difficult to understand,isn't he?

phrases.phrase: 食べにくい食べ物がきらいだ。
translations: I don't like difficult to eat foods.

phrases.phrase: このめずらしい切手は手にはいりにくいんだよ。
translations: This rare stamp is hard to come by.

phrases.phrase: タイガーティの説明はとてもわかりにくいですね｡
translations: tigert`s explanation is very difficult to understand.

phrases.phrase: 英語での本を読みにくいです。
translations: It's hard to read the book in English.

meaning.meaning: Indicates a change which has taken place or will take place.
meaning.example: I came to have an interest in Japan after I went to Japan

phrases.phrase: 彼は日本に住んでいたくせに、日本語を話せるようにならなかったよ。
translations: Although he lived in Japan he didn't learn (become able) to speak Japanese!

phrases.phrase: 子供は, 自分で部屋を片付けるようになりました。
translations: (My) child has reached the point where she cleans up her room herself.

phrases.phrase: 赤ちゃんは, もうすぐ笑うようになる。
translations: The baby will soon reach the point where he will smile.

phrases.phrase: 日本に来たから、豆腐を食べるようになりました。
translations: Since I came to Japan, I've gotten used to eating tofu. (I didn't use to eat tofu.)

phrases.phrase: レンズさんは日本語が話せるようになった。
translations: Mr. Renz had reached the point where he can speak Japanese.

meaning.example: When we talk about speed, there is no point comparing a plane and a ship.

readings.reading: くらべものにならない

phrases.phrase: 速さという点では飛行機は船とは比べものにならない。
translations: When we talk about speed, there is no point to compare a plane and a ship.

phrases.phrase: 食べる量という点では馬は鳥とは比べものにならない。
translations: What a horse eats and what a chicken eats just cannot be compared.

phrases.phrase: このほうが比べものにならないほど優れている。
translations: This is superior beyond comparison.

phrases.phrase: 私の業績はあなたの業績とは比べものにならない。
translations: Your achievements cannot be compared with mine.

phrases.phrase: 私の料理などお母さんのとは比べものにならない。
translations: My cooking cannot hold a candle to Mother's.

meaning.meaning: to the extent that; so ~ that ~ almost ~; at least; the only ~; rather than ~
meaning.example: It's so warm this evening that we (almost) don't need a heater.

phrases.phrase: 今晩は暖かいので、ストーブが要らないくらいだ。
translations: It's so warm this evening that we almost  don't need a heater.

phrases.phrase: 私たちは一歩も歩けないくらい疲れていた。
translations: We were so tired that we couldn't take a single step.

phrases.phrase: 山田さんくらい物を忘れる人はいない。
translations: There's no one as forgetful as Yamada (who forgets things as much as Yamada).

phrases.phrase: 私は料理は下手ですが、ご飯くらい(は)炊けます。
translations: I'm a poor cook, but I can at least cook rice.

phrases.phrase: 今この仕事が出来るのは彼くらいのものだ。
translations: He's the only person who can do this job now. (The person who's capable enough to do this job is he.)

meaning.meaning: I am about to / I was about to
meaning.example: He arrived just as I was about to give up.

usages: Vた形／Vていた形+ところ（だ）

phrases.phrase: 私は息子がクッキーを盗み食いしようとしているところを見つけた。
translations: I caught my son stealing from a cookie jar.

phrases.phrase: バスは発車するところだった。
translations: The bus was about to start.

phrases.phrase: 今、食べる所です。
translations: Right now, I'm just about to eat.

phrases.phrase: これから、部屋を掃除するところです。
translations: I'm just about to start cleaning up my room.

phrases.phrase: 食事がおいしくないといってくれて、ありがとう、危うく食べる所でした。
translations: Thanks for telling me the food wasn't good, I was just about to eat it.

meaning.example: I don't eat /meat/ (but I do eat fish).

phrases.phrase: 私は肉は食べない。
translations: I don't eat / meat / . (but I eat fish)

phrases.phrase: 「セリーナをみせて！」「心配は要らない。いきてはいる、いきて。」
translations: "Show me Serena!" "No need to worry. She's / alive / . Alive (but _not_ well)."

phrases.phrase: いや、でも野球を見に行くのは好きだけどね。
translations: No, but I like + going to baseball.

phrases.phrase: 私は、足し算は好きだけど、引き算は嫌いだ。
translations: I like + addition but + subtraction.

phrases.phrase: 彼は上海で住んでいたので、戦争は彼とは全く関係のないところで行われていた．
translations: Because he was living in Shang-hai, the war was being fought (lit. performed) in places that did not have a connection with him at all.

meaning.example: I hear it's going to snow.

phrases.phrase: 天気予報を聞いてたら雪が降るそうです。
translations: When I listened to the weather forcast they reckoned it's going to snow.

phrases.phrase: 電話したら彼はいないそうです。
translations: Upon phoning, I was told that he wasn't there.

phrases.phrase: 彼はいないのですかと聞いたらそうだといわれました。
translations: When I asked if he was not there, I was told that it was so.

phrases.phrase: そうですか！
translations: Is that so!

phrases.phrase: なんでそうやねん(Kansai Dialect)
translations: Why so?

meaning.meaning: ! (exclamation mark, add emphasis, denote new information being imparted)
meaning.example: The bus is coming!

phrases.phrase: バスが来るよ。
translations: The bus is coming !

phrases.phrase: それは大変なことだよ。
translations: That's pretty serious, you realize that!

phrases.phrase: あなたが好きなんだよ
translations: I like you, you know!

phrases.phrase: 好い加減にしなさいよ。
translations: Shape up !

phrases.phrase: いいよ。
translations: Sure!

meaning.example: My doctor told me to stop drinking.

phrases.phrase: 医者に控えるように言われているのでお酒が飲めなくて、ウズウズしている。
translations: My doctor told me to lay off the liquor so I have this uneasy impatient feeling.

phrases.phrase: 医者は彼に酒を控えるように忠告した。
translations: The doctor advised him to keep away from drinking.

phrases.phrase: 医者なら誰でも君に禁煙するように言うだろう。
translations: Any doctor will tell you to quit smoking.

phrases.phrase: 私は図書館の職員に金曜日締め切りのレポートのためにその本が必要だと言った。そうしたら彼女は借りている人に返却を求めるように言うと言った。
translations: I told the librarian that I needed the book for a report due on Friday; so she said she would call it in.

phrases.phrase: 先生は私たちに毎日教室を掃除するように言う。
translations: The teacher tells us to clean our classroom every day.

meaning.example: A sound like rain falling

phrases.phrase: 雨が降るような音がしました。
translations: There was a sound like  rain falling.

phrases.phrase: そして、ウッドは「負けたら承知しないぞ」と言うように全員をにらみつけた。
translations: Then Wood stared at all the team members like he was saying "I won't accept it if you're defeated!"

phrases.phrase: 星のように輝いてる瞳。
translations: Eyes that sparkle like stars.

phrases.phrase: そのようなこともあるのでしょうね。
translations: I guess something like that could happen.

phrases.phrase: 安いようだ。
translations: Looks  cheap.

meaning.example: by the way it looks like rain

phrases.phrase: 雨が降ってきたなあところで飯にしないか
translations: Hey, it's starting to rain By the way you want to go get something to eat?

phrases.phrase: ( 「ところで」の他の意味 )私が説得したところであいつは耳をかさないだろう.
translations: (alternate usage) No matter how much I try to persuade him, that guy won't listen.

phrases.phrase: ところで、あなたの仕事は何ですか。
translations: By the way, what do you do?

phrases.phrase: ところで、あなたは宿題をしましたか。
translations: By the way, have you done your homework?

phrases.phrase: ところで、ちょっと君に話がある。
translations: By the way, I have something to tell you.

meaning.example: Rain started to fall.

phrases.phrase: 地震が収まると、みんな家を飛び出した
translations: When the earthquake subsided, everybody started running out of the houses.

phrases.phrase: 泥棒が警察を見て、突然走り出しました。
translations: When the burglar saw the police he imediately started running.

phrases.phrase: 彼女は笑い出した。
translations: She started in laughing.

phrases.phrase: 気圧計は昨夜下がり出したが朝には止まった。
translations: The barometer started to fall last night but stopped in the morning.

phrases.phrase: 朝から雨が降り出した。
translations: It began to rain this morning.

meaning.example: It takes time to learn Japanese

phrases.phrase: 日本語を覚えるのに、時間がかかります
translations: It takes time in order to , learn japanese

phrases.phrase: あなたに会うのには何時(いつ）/何処(どこ）がいいですか。
translations: What would be the good time/place in order to /to see you?

phrases.phrase: パスポートは海外旅行に行くのに必要です。
translations: A passport is necessary in order to travel overseas.

phrases.phrase: 水着は泳ぐのに使う。
translations: Swimwear is used for swimming.

phrases.phrase: 私がその仕事を仕上げるのに５ヶ月かかった。
translations: It took me five months to complete the job.

meaning.meaning: Turn a phrase ending in a verb into a 'noun phrase'
meaning.example: Getting married is such an effort!

phrases.phrase: 結婚するのは大変だ。
translations: Getting married is such an effort!

phrases.phrase: 「さあ、皆さん、正々堂々戦いましょう」全選手が周りに集まるのを待って先生が言った。
translations: "Well, everyone, let's play fair and square." the teacher said after waiting for all the players to assemble + .

phrases.phrase: 夢に耽ったり、生きることを忘れてしまうのはよくない。
translations: Becoming absorbed in a dream, forgett ing to live is no good.

phrases.phrase: 私も買い物に行くのが好きです。
translations: I also like to go shopping.

phrases.phrase: アルバイトをしながら学校に行くのは大変ですね。
translations: Having a part time job while going to school is hard, right?

meaning.meaning: Adds emphasis - sentence ending particle; Emphasizes personal desires
meaning.example: Won't it be great if we can go fishing tomorrow?

phrases.phrase: 明日は釣れるといいなあ！
translations: Won't it be great if (we) can fish tommorow!

phrases.phrase: 冷たいビールを飲みたいなあ。
translations: I'd really like a cold beer. / I could really go for a cold beer.

phrases.phrase: 腹減ったなあ。
translations: I'm so hungry.

phrases.phrase: きれいだなぁ〜。
translations: Oh, how beautiful.

phrases.phrase: 冷たいビールをのみたいなぁ〜。
translations: I want to drink a cold beer.

meaning.example: Sit down.

phrases.phrase: 「一人で間違えずに歌える自信のある人だけ座りなさい。」と指示しました
translations: [The teacher] directed that (just) people who had the confidence that they could sing, on their own, without error should sit down.

phrases.phrase: 早くしなさい。
translations: Do it quickly.

phrases.phrase: 好い加減にしなさいよ。
translations: Shape up!

phrases.phrase: 野菜を食べなさい！
translations: Eat your vegetables!

phrases.phrase: 座りなさい。
translations: Sit down.

meaning.meaning: I wonder.. (Based on か question particle.)
meaning.example: I wonder if he'll be here soon?

phrases.phrase: この靴は高いかな
translations: I wonder if these shoes are expensive

phrases.phrase: 締め切りに間に合わなかったらどうなるかな。
translations: What if I miss the deadline?

phrases.phrase: 「彼の病気は重いのかな。」「そうでないといいね。」
translations: "Is he seriously ill ?" "I hope not."

phrases.phrase: 「肘が痛むんだよ。病院に行こうかな。」
translations: "My elbow really hurts. I guess I should go to a hospital."

phrases.phrase: ７月の上旬に、海に行くのは早いかな。
translations: I wonder if the first week (or so) of July is too early to go to the beach.

meaning.example: I took the trouble to go and see him, but he wasn't there

phrases.phrase: せっかく会いに行ったのに、友達はいませんでした。
translations: I took the effort to go and see my friend, but he wasn't there

phrases.phrase: せっかくいい大学に入ったのだからよく勉強するつもりです。
translations: I worked hard to get into a good college, so I intend to study hard

phrases.phrase: 人がせっかく作ってくれた料理を食べないのは失礼だ。
translations: It's impolite not to eat food which someone has taken the trouble  of preparing for you. (from An Integrated Approach to Intermediate Japanese)

phrases.phrase: せっかく彼女に手紙を書いたのに、送るのを忘れちゃった。
translations: I took the effort  to write a letter to her and forgot to send it.

phrases.phrase: せっかく母親が買ってきたシャツをどうしても着ようとしなかった。
translations: After all of the trouble  my mother went to buy the shirt, I did not wear it.

phrases.phrase: 今着いたところです
translations: I am just now arriving (Lit: now arrival time is)

phrases.phrase: このホテルは公共交通機関の点から見ると便利な所に位置している。
translations: This hotel is in a convenient place in terms of public transportation.

phrases.phrase: あなたはそれを終えましたか。それどこか、今始めたところです。
translations: Have you finished it? On the contrary, I've just begun.

phrases.phrase: あなたは昨晩私が彼女と二人っきりでいるところを見つけて驚いたにちがいない。
translations: You must have been surprised to find me with her alone last night.

phrases.phrase: あなたは当分の間私のところにいても良い。
translations: You may stay with me for the time being.

meaning.example: The dog ate my homework (so) I can't turn it in today.

phrases.phrase: 家が狭いものですから大きい家具は置けません
translations: The house is small (narrow) [so / therefore] you cant put big furniture in (it).

phrases.phrase: 一人っ子なものだからわがままに育ててしまいました。
translations: It ((s)he) was an only child and so grew selfish

phrases.phrase: 遅くなってごめんね。道路が込んでいたもんだから。
translations: I'm sorry I'm late, I got caught in a traffic jam.

phrases.phrase: 上着を脱いでもいいですか。暑いものですから。
translations: Can I take my jacket off? I'm feeling a bit hot.

phrases.phrase: 僕は何でも嗅げれない。どうやら風邪を引っちゃったよ。ものだから。
translations: It seems I have caught I cold and cant smell anything. ものだから

meaning.example: the reverse

phrases.phrase: その反面
translations: on the other hand

phrases.phrase: 普通兄は優しい反面、卑しいところもある。
translations: My older brother is usually kind, but on the other hand he can be mean.

phrases.phrase: その仕事は十分にお金になるが、その反面１日に１２時間働かなくてはならない。
translations: The job pays well, but on the other hand I have to work twelve hours a day.

phrases.phrase: この布は水に強い反面,熱には弱い.
translations: This cloth is strong in water on the other hand, is vulnerable to heat.

phrases.phrase: インターネットは子供にとって役に立つ学習ツールだが、反面、しっかりその使い方を指導しない子供がポルノや沫ﾍシーンの画像に簡単に接してしまうことになりかねない。
translations: The internet is a useful learning tool for children. On the other hand, it can expose them to pornographic or violent images if they are allowed to use it unsupervised.

meaning.meaning: Try to do something, but the nuance is that it was unsuccessful.
meaning.example: I tried to kiss her, but she said no.

phrases.phrase: このコンピューターを使おうとしたが、ダメだった。
translations: I tried to use this computer, but I couldn't.

phrases.phrase: 電車に乗ろうとしたら、ドアが閉まってしまいました。
translations: I was about to get on the train when the door closed on me.

phrases.phrase: 彼が彼女にキスしようとした時、,お母さんが 部屋に入って来た（のでキスできなかった）。
translations: He was trying to kiss his girlfriend when his mom walked in the room. (so I did not get to kiss her)

phrases.phrase: 私は彼に真実な気持ちを言おうとしたが、彼の携帯電話が鳴ってしまいました。言おうとした
translations: I tried to tell him how I felt,but his phone rang. Tried

phrases.phrase: 人間の寿命は短いって分かっていたのに、なんでもっと知ろうと思わなかったんだろう。 ～フレーレン
translations: I knew human lives were short. Why didn`t I try to get to know  him better? ーFrieren

meaning.meaning: to affect the senses (to taste, to smell of, to feel like, to give the sensation of etc.)
meaning.example: This room smells of gas.

phrases.phrase: 「ちょっと目まいがするわ。」「顔色が悪いぞ。一日休んだほうがいいよ。」
translations: " I feel sort of dizzy." "You look pale. You'd better take a day off." [F] [M]

phrases.phrase: このスープは魚の味がする。
translations: This soup tastes of fish.

phrases.phrase: この部屋はガスのにおいがする。
translations: This room smells of gas.

phrases.phrase: あなたも血のにおいがするな.
translations: I smell blood on you too.

meaning.example: Who's it?

phrases.phrase: 誰だい。
translations: Who is it ?

phrases.phrase: 何をこそこそしているんだい。
translations: What are you doing sneaking around ?

phrases.phrase: いつまで起きているんだい。早く寝なさい！
translations: Why are you still up ? Just go to bed!

phrases.phrase: その優しげな目の奥にあるのは本当に何を知りたいんだい?
translations: What do you wanna know in your cute eyes?

point: しまう (仕舞う・終う・了う)

meaning.meaning: Vte, (Definitely, completely [often to ones regret] do V)
meaning.example: Now you've gone and broke it.

phrases.phrase: もう〜。また皿を壊してしまったか。
translations: Good grief. (That) another plate (you've) gone and broken?

phrases.phrase: 夢に耽ったり、生きることを忘れてしまうのはよくない。
translations: Becoming absorbed in a dream, forgetting to live is no good.

phrases.phrase: あなたは笑われてしまうでしょう。
translations: You will be laughed at.

phrases.phrase: 電車の中に財布を落としてしまった。
translations: I lost my wallet in the train.

meaning.meaning: To be, is (formal equivalent of だ [da])

phrases.phrase: 医者である田中さん
translations: The Tanaka san who is a doctor.

phrases.phrase: そうであるとしても、この場合は別でしょう。
translations: Even if that is correct, would it not have to be different in this case?

phrases.phrase: いつも正直であるということは、容易なことではない。
translations: To be always honest is not easy.

phrases.phrase: "We" are a cat (famous novel title).
translations: 我輩は猫である。

meaning.example: I want to see a Bond movie!

phrases.phrase: ボンドの映画を見たいな〜。
translations: I wanna see the Bond movie!

phrases.phrase: この車を買いたいんですが、お金が無い。
translations: I want to buy this car but I don't have the money.

phrases.phrase: あなたは何をしたいのですか。
translations: What would you like to do?

phrases.phrase: 彼女は私のすることをいつみ知りたがる。
translations: She`s always curious about (as to) what I`m doing.

meaning.example: I walked through the park.

phrases.phrase: 公園を歩きました。
translations: I walked (through/in) the park.

phrases.phrase: 12歳のとき、私は川を泳いで渡ることができた。
translations: I could swim + across the river when I was twelve.

phrases.phrase: この列車はニューヨークとボストン間を走っている。
translations: This train runs + between New York and Boston.

phrases.phrase: お忙しいところをお出で頂きありがとうございます。

phrases.phrase: 部屋を出た。
translations: I left the room.

phrases.phrase: 大阪を出発する。
translations: He leaves + Osaka.

phrases.phrase: 去年日本を離れた。
translations: I left + Japan last year.

phrases.phrase: １９００年に彼はイギリスを去った。
translations: In 1900 he left + England.

point: て形+ある (て在る・て有る)

meaning.meaning: Vte something has been purposely put into a state

phrases.phrase: 窓が開けてある。
translations: The window has been left open.

phrases.phrase: 窓が閉めてある。
translations: The window has been closed.

phrases.phrase: 窓を（は）開けてある。
translations: I left the window open.

phrases.phrase: 窓を（は）閉めてある。
translations: I kept the window closed.

phrases.phrase: 新聞を買ってくる。
translations: I'll go buy the newspaper. (implying you'll be back)

phrases.phrase: 医者に行って薬をもらってきました。

phrases.phrase: 日本語が少しずつ分かってきた
translations: Little by little, I came to understand Japanese.

phrases.phrase: 物価が下がってくる。
translations: Prices continue to fall.

meaning.meaning: when you talk of, speaking of, when you say

translations: When you hear 'Switzerland' what does it invoke in your mind?

phrases.phrase: 何故かといわれても、知りません
translations: If you ask me why, I don't know.

phrases.phrase: これはあくまでも予定以外のなにものでもない。
translations: This is only a plan and nothing more than that.

phrases.phrase: 明日この宿題を終わる予定です。
translations: I plan to finish this assignment tomorrow.

phrases.phrase: 来週帰国する予定です。
translations: I plan to go back to my home country next week.

phrases.phrase: 来年彼女と結婚する予定です。
translations: next year I am planning to marry her.

meaning.example: try to read

phrases.phrase: 着てみてもいい？
translations: Is it ok if i try it on to see?

phrases.phrase: あなたは自分で行って見るべきです。

phrases.phrase: 老いた故郷の両親のことを考えて見るべきだ。
translations: You must think of your old parents at home.

phrases.phrase: やって見ようか？

meaning.meaning: to pay, to place, to issue, to stick out, to put forth, to serve
meaning.example: to pay, to place, to issue, to stick out, to put forth, to serve

phrases.phrase: まど　から　くび　を　だす。
translations: Lean out the window.

phrases.phrase: わたし　の　かいしゃ　は　ほん　を　出した。
translations: My company published a book.

phrases.phrase: ごみ　を　出す。
translations: Take out the garbage.

phrases.phrase: お金　を　出す　から　買って　ください。
translations: I will pay (for it), please buy it.

meaning.meaning: thinking about, concerned about, worried about

phrases.phrase: 何かきになることがある？
translations: Is there something you're worried about?

phrases.phrase: A:なんでその変なスタイルにしたの？ Ｂ：何か、気になるよ
translations: A:Why did you go with that weird style? B:Well, the feeling just came to me!

phrases.phrase: Well, the feeling just came to me!
translations: Ｂ：何か、気になるよ

phrases.phrase: 子供の教育のことが気になる。
translations: I'm worried about my child's education.

phrases.phrase: バスを降りようとすると、後ろから押された。
translations: I was about to get off the bus, when someone pushed me from behind.

phrases.phrase: 出かけようとすると、父に呼ばれた。
translations: I was just about to go out, when dad called me.

phrases.phrase: お風呂に入ろうとしたときに、電話が鳴りました。
translations: The telephone rang just as I was about to get into the bath.

phrases.phrase: 彼女に告白しようとすると、突然友達が来ました。
translations: when i try to propose her suddenly friend are come.

meaning.meaning: to the extent of; to the extent that ~; (not as) ~ as ~ ; about [REL. bakari; kurai]

phrases.phrase: 僕は君ほど速く歩けません。

phrases.phrase: ジェニファーほどよく勉強する学生はいない。
translations: There is no student who studies as hard as Jennifer.

translations: I didn't think that Mr. Nishida could play the piano that well . (lit. to that extent)

translations: Mr. Lewis's Japanese is so good that even Prof. Ota didn't notice he was a foreigner.

meaning.meaning: absolutely, surely, by all means, no matter what, at any cost; after all
meaning.example: No matter what I did, Tom wouldn't do what I told him.

phrases.phrase: どうしても事故は起こるものだ。

phrases.phrase: どうしても痩せたい
translations: I'd like to lose weight no matter what.

phrases.phrase: どうしても上手になりたいです。
translations: I want to improve no matter what  .

phrases.phrase: どうしても試験に合格したいです
translations: I wanna pass examination no matter what

phrases.phrase: 私はきっと変な人だと思われてる。
translations: I'm sure I'm thought of as an odd person.

phrases.phrase: 彼女はきれいな足をしている。
translations: She has beautiful legs.

phrases.phrase: 静かなレストランに行きましょう。
translations: Let's go to a quiet restaurant.

meaning.meaning: have just done something; have just finished doing something’

phrases.phrase: 日本へ行ったばかりのころは、日本語がわからなくて困りました。
translations: When I was a newcomer to Japan, I had trouble understanding Japanese.

phrases.phrase: 食べたばかりだから、ちょっと待ってください。
translations: I just ate so please wait a bit.

phrases.phrase: 働き始めたばかりのとき、僕も間違えたよ。
translations: When I had just begun working, I made some mistakes too.

phrases.phrase: 2つのことを一度にしようとしてはいけません。

phrases.phrase: このような（子供の）態度は、自分たちがある程度独立していることを示そうとしての結果なのである。
translations: This is because they are trying to prove they are somewhat independent.

translations: When they were trying to eat ice cream, they noticed they didn't have a spoon. There's no way to eat. What should we do?

meaning.example: it seems like he is faking his injury

phrases.phrase: わざとらしい笑い。
translations: An artificial smile.

phrases.phrase: 彼のわざとらしい話し方が嫌いだ。
translations: I don't like his affected manner of speaking.

phrases.phrase: 彼のけがするのは、わざとらしいですね
translations: It`s like he is faking his injury.

meaning.example: teach me how to write this kanji

phrases.phrase: 私は英語の手紙の書き方を知っています。
translations: I know how to write a letter in English.

phrases.phrase: この漢字の読み方を教えてください。

phrases.phrase: いろいろな人の考え方を見出すのが好きです。
translations: I like to discover various people's way of thinking.

meaning.example: Turn in the report by Friday.

phrases.phrase: 明日までにそれを済ませてしまうべきです。

phrases.phrase: お昼までに戻らないといけない。

phrases.phrase: 書類を夜までにださなければなりません。

meaning.meaning: must ____; really should _____; it won't do if you don't ____.

phrases.phrase: 野菜を食べなければなりません。

phrases.phrase: お店で卵を買わなければなりません。なければなりません。
translations: I have to buy eggs at the store. なければなりません

phrases.phrase: 毎日日本語を勉強しなければなりません。
translations: I must study Japanese everyday

meaning.meaning: by doing this　(meant to highlight a method or means)

translations: By listening to Japanese music, you will become better. (at understanding Japanese) By listening to Japanese music

phrases.phrase: 退席することで実は正しいことをすることになる。
translations: You may actually be doing the right thing by walking out.

phrases.phrase: まいにちれんしゅうすることで、にほんごがぺらぺらになりました。
translations: Everyday by studying japanese language, you will be better.

meaning.meaning: Used much like the な of na-adjectives - somewhat archaic.

phrases.phrase: 悪魔め！俺様は聖なる剣で貴様を倒す！
translations: Foul demon! _I_ will smite you with this sacred + sword!

phrases.phrase: うちは毎年９月末の日曜日にすると決まっているのです。
translations: It's our rule to make it the last Sunday of September every year.

phrases.phrase: そのようにすると後で困らない？
translations: if you do it this way, won't you be troubled later on?

meaning.meaning: Vte (Continuing states, experience, repetative events)/ doing currently
meaning.example: The window is open.

phrases.phrase: 私 は 食べている
translations: I am eating now

phrases.phrase: あなた は 見ている
translations: You are looking now

phrases.phrase: 彼女はコートなしで出かけました
translations: she went out without wearing a coat

usages: Verb ~ない form without ない+ずに

phrases.phrase: 勉強せずにテストを受けた。

translations: What happened? You are really pale.

phrases.phrase: どうしたのですか。頭が痛いのです。

phrases.phrase: 留学することになりました。

meaning.meaning: I wonder if...　（A type of question mark)

phrases.phrase: いくらかしら。
translations: I wonder how much it is.

translations: Like/similar to many Americans, he is very friendly.

point: ということですね (と云う事ですね)

meaning.example: you are coming to tokyo tomorrow,right?

phrases.phrase: 少しずつそうなったということですね
translations: its a gradual thing,isn't it?

meaning.meaning: just like, alike to, similar to
meaning.example: she's flying just like a bird!

phrases.phrase: この写真のようなカットが欲しい。
